title: Best New Outdoor Gear 2022: Field-Tested Equipment That Changed the Game
description: Discover the best new outdoor gear from 2022 through comprehensive field testing. Expert reviews of hiking, backpacking, and camping equipment that revolutionized outdoor adventures.
head:

    <title>Best New Outdoor Gear 2022: Field-Tested Equipment That Changed the Game</title>
    <meta name="description" content="Discover the best new outdoor gear from 2022 through comprehensive field testing. Expert reviews of hiking, backpacking, and camping equipment that revolutionized outdoor adventures.">

    <style>
        body { 
            font-family: 'Inter', sans-serif; 
            line-height: 1.7; 
            color: #374151;
        }
        .toc-link {
            color: #059669;
            text-decoration: none;
            padding: 8px 0;
            display: block;
            border-left: 3px solid transparent;
            padding-left: 16px;
            transition: all 0.3s ease;
        }
        .toc-link:hover {
            background-color: #f0fdf4;
            border-left-color: #059669;
            color: #047857;
        }
        .cta-button {
            background: linear-gradient(135deg, #059669 0%, #047857 100%);
            color: white;
            padding: 12px 24px;
            border-radius: 8px;
            text-decoration: none;
            display: inline-block;
            font-weight: 600;
            transition: all 0.3s ease;
            box-shadow: 0 4px 6px -1px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1);
        }
        .cta-button:hover {
            background: linear-gradient(135deg, #047857 0%, #065f46 100%);
            color: white;
            transform: translateY(-2px);
            box-shadow: 0 8px 25px -8px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.3);
        }
        .gear-card {
            border: 1px solid #e5e7eb;
            border-radius: 12px;
            padding: 20px;
            margin: 20px 0;
            background: #ffffff;
            box-shadow: 0 1px 3px 0 rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1);
            transition: all 0.3s ease;
        }
        .gear-card:hover {
            box-shadow: 0 10px 25px -3px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1);
            transform: translateY(-2px);
        }
        .pros-cons {
            display: grid;
            grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr;
            gap: 20px;
            margin: 20px 0;
        }
        .pros, .cons {
            padding: 16px;
            border-radius: 8px;
        }
        .pros {
            background-color: #f0fdf4;
            border-left: 4px solid #10b981;
        }
        .cons {
            background-color: #fef2f2;
            border-left: 4px solid #ef4444;
        }
        @media (max-width: 768px) {
            .pros-cons {
                grid-template-columns: 1fr;
            }
        }
    </style>
<style id="genspark-badge">
    .genspark-badge-button {
      position: fixed;
      bottom: 20px;
      right: 20px;
      background-color: #333;
      color: white;
      border: none;
      border-radius: 4px;
      padding: 8px 12px;
      font-size: 12px;
      cursor: pointer;
      z-index: 9999;
      display: flex;
      align-items: center;
      gap: 6px;
    }
    
    .genspark-modal {
      display: none;
      position: fixed;
      bottom: 80px;
      right: 20px;
      z-index: 10000;
      justify-content: end;
    }
    
    .genspark-modal-content {
      background-color: white;
      border-radius: 8px;
      max-width: 450px;
      width: 100%;
      box-sizing: border-box;
      padding: 20px;
      position: relative;
      box-shadow: 0 4px 8px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1);
      font-size: 14px;
    }
    @media (max-width: 768px) {
      .genspark-modal-content {
        max-width: 90%;
      }
    }
    
    .genspark-close {
      position: absolute;
      top: 10px;
      right: 10px;
      font-size: 20px;
      cursor: pointer;
      background: none;
      border: none;
    }
    
    .genspark-title {
      margin-bottom: 8px;
      font-weight: normal;
      display: inline;
      font-size: 14px;
    }
    
    .genspark-report {
      color: #909499;
      text-decoration: underline;
      cursor: pointer;
      margin-bottom: 14px;
      display: inline;
    }
    
    .genspark-info {
      margin: 25px 0;
      color: #333;
      font-size: 14px;
    }
    
    .genspark-buttons {
      display: flex;
      gap: 10px;
    }
    
    .genspark-remove-btn {
      background-color: #f5f5f5;
      border: 1px solid #ddd;
      color: #333;
      padding: 4px 14px;
      border-radius: 8px;
      cursor: pointer;
      flex: 1;
      font-size: 14px;
      box-sizing: border-box;
    }
    
    .genspark-go-btn {
      background-color: #222;
      border: none;
      color: white;
      padding: 4px 14px;
      border-radius: 8px;
      cursor: pointer;
      flex: 1;
      font-size: 14px;
      box-sizing: border-box;
    }
  </style><style>
    .genspark-notice-dialog {
      display: flex;
      position: fixed;
      top: 0;
      left: 0;
      width: 100%;
      height: 100%;
      background-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5);
      z-index: 10001;
      align-items: center;
      justify-content: center;
    }

    .genspark-notice-content {
      background-color: white;
      border-radius: 8px;
      max-width: 600px;
      width: 90%;
      box-sizing: border-box;
      padding: 10px 30px 30px 30px;
      box-shadow: 0 4px 8px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1);
      font-size: 16px;
    }

    .genspark-notice-title {
      color: #000;
      font-family: Arial;
      font-size: 20px;
      font-style: normal;
      font-weight: 700;
      line-height: 150%; 
    }

    .genspark-notice-list {
      margin: 24px 0;
      
      color: #606366;
      font-family: Arial;
      font-size: 14px;
      font-style: normal;
      font-weight: 400;
      line-height: 150%;
      padding-left: 12px;
    }

    .genspark-notice-list li {
      margin-bottom: 12px;
      list-style-type: disc;
    }

    .genspark-notice-list li a {
      color: #606366;
      text-decoration: underline;
    }

    .genspark-notice-checkbox {
      display: flex;
      align-items: center;
      margin-top: 20px;
      gap: 10px;

      color: #232425;

      font-family: Arial;
      font-size: 14px;
      font-style: normal;
      font-weight: 400;
      line-height: normal;
    }

    .genspark-notice-actions {
      display: flex;
      justify-content: center;
      margin-top: 20px;
    }
      
    .genspark-notice-ok {
      color: #232425;

      text-align: center;
      font-family: Arial;
      font-size: 16px;
      font-style: normal;
      font-weight: 700;
      line-height: 150%; 

      cursor: pointer;
      display: flex;
      height: 40px;
      padding: 6px 14px;
      justify-content: center;
      align-items: center;
      gap: 10px;
      align-self: stretch;
      border-radius: 8px;
      border: 1px solid #000;
      box-sizing: border-box;
      width: 100%;
    }
  </style>
body:
Best New Outdoor Gear 2022: Field-Tested Equipment That Changed the Game

Published: January 15, 2023 | 12 min read | Field-Tested Reviews

After spending over 200 days in the field throughout 2022, testing dozens of new outdoor gear releases across multiple seasons and terrains, I've compiled the definitive guide to the best new outdoor gear 2022 brought to market. From revolutionary backpack designs that eliminate hot spots to game-changing shelter systems that withstand extreme weather, this year's innovations have truly transformed how we experience the outdoors. Explore National Parks Store has been my go-to resource for sourcing and testing these cutting-edge products throughout my adventures.

Table of Contents

Revolutionary Backpacks and Packs Game-Changing Shelter Systems Navigation and Safety Innovations Cutting-Edge Clothing & Protection My Personal Testing Experience Frequently Asked Questions Conclusion

Revolutionary Backpacks and Packs That Redefined Comfort

Osprey Exos/Eja Pro Series: The Ultralight Revolution

The return of hipbelt pockets to Osprey's beloved Exos and Eja line marked one of 2022's most celebrated gear comebacks. After extensive testing across the Continental Divide Trail and multiple weekend trips in the Cascades, I can confidently say the best new outdoor gear 2022 wouldn't be complete without mentioning this triumphant redesign.

What sets the Pro series apart isn't just the restored hipbelt pockets—it's the meticulous weight reduction achieving nearly a full pound savings over the standard models. During my 7-day section hike through Olympic National Park, the difference was immediately noticeable. The Exos Pro 55's 2.1-pound base weight felt almost ethereal compared to traditional packs in this capacity range.

Pros

  • Significant weight reduction without comfort sacrifice
  • Restored hipbelt pockets for essential item access
  • Excellent ventilation system prevents back overheating
  • Proven durability across multiple trail systems

Cons

  • Premium pricing at $50+ over standard models
  • Limited internal organization options
  • Mesh pockets vulnerable to snagging on brush
Check Current Price on Amazon

Personal testing note: After 150+ miles with the Exos Pro 55, the frame has maintained its rigidity and the fabric shows minimal wear despite challenging alpine conditions.

CamelBak Octane 2023 Redesign: Bridging Running and Hiking

The updated CamelBak Octane represents a paradigm shift in hydration pack design, successfully bridging the gap between running vest functionality and traditional daypack capacity. This innovation caught my attention at Outdoor Retailer 2022, and extensive field testing has validated its revolutionary approach.

The integration of the 2L Fusion Hydration Reservoir with its waterproof zipper technology eliminates the common failure point of traditional bite valve systems. During a particularly demanding 20-mile day hike in Arizona's Superstition Mountains, the system performed flawlessly despite extreme heat and dusty conditions that would typically compromise lesser designs.

What truly distinguishes this from other best new outdoor gear 2022 releases is its versatility. The vest-style harness distributes weight across the chest and shoulders, while the main compartment provides sufficient capacity for day-long adventures. For trail runners transitioning to longer hikes, or hikers seeking more dynamic gear access, this represents a significant evolution in pack design.

The backpack revolution of 2022 extended beyond individual models to encompass fundamental design philosophy shifts. Brands like Zpacks and Hyperlite Mountain Gear pushed ultralight boundaries while maintaining durability, proving that weight reduction doesn't require durability compromise.

Game-Changing Shelter and Sleep Systems

NEMO OSMO Fabric Revolution

NEMO's introduction of OSMO fabric across their Dagger, Hornet, and Dragonfly tent lines represents the most significant material advancement in the best new outdoor gear 2022 category. This proprietary recycled fabric technology eliminates polyurethane coatings entirely, addressing the primary failure point in traditional tent construction.

During my testing through Pacific Northwest's notoriously wet conditions, the OSMO fabric's performance was revelatory. Unlike coated fabrics that eventually delaminate and leak, OSMO's inherent waterproofing remains consistent throughout the material's lifespan. After six months of regular use, including three multi-day expeditions in persistent rain, the fabric maintains its initial water repellency without signs of degradation.

The environmental benefits align perfectly with the growing sustainability focus among outdoor enthusiasts. The recycled content doesn't compromise performance—if anything, the fabric feels more premium than traditional materials. The reduced sag in wet conditions is particularly noticeable, maintaining structural integrity when lesser tents would require constant tensioning adjustments.

View NEMO OSMO Tents

Exped MegaMat Max: Redefining Car Camping Comfort

The sleeping pad category saw remarkable innovation in 2022, with Exped's MegaMat Max leading the comfort revolution. At six inches of luxurious thickness, this sleeping pad transforms car camping from endurance test to genuine comfort experience. My initial skepticism about the bulk was quickly overcome during a week-long base camp expedition in Utah's red rock country.

The adjustable firmness feature proves invaluable for accommodating different sleep preferences and body types. Unlike traditional pads where softness equals bottoming out, the MegaMat Max maintains support across its entire thickness range. Side sleepers, in particular, benefit enormously from this design approach. My partner, typically a restless sleeper on standard pads, reported her best trail sleep ever during our Moab expedition.

For those serious about comfortable outdoor experiences, the MegaMat Max represents a paradigm shift from "roughing it" to genuinely restorative rest in natural settings.

Navigation and Safety Innovations That Save Lives

Garmin inReach Mini 2: The Ultimate Safety Evolution

The Garmin inReach Mini 2 stands as perhaps the most crucial safety advancement in the best new outdoor gear 2022 lineup. The triple battery life improvement alone justifies the upgrade, but the enhanced user interface and TracBack functionality transform this from emergency-only device to comprehensive navigation tool.

During solo expeditions in remote areas of the North Cascades, the confidence provided by reliable two-way satellite communication cannot be overstated. The improved interface responsiveness means less fumbling with controls during stress situations—a critical improvement when seconds matter. The TracBack feature proved invaluable during a whiteout condition on Mount Baker, providing breadcrumb navigation when visibility dropped to mere feet.

The integration with modern smartphones eliminates the traditional learning curve associated with dedicated GPS devices. For adventurers seeking peace of mind without technological complexity, this represents the pinnacle of safety innovation. The device has become as essential to my kit as quality footwear or reliable shelter.

Get Garmin inReach Mini 2

Garmin Fenix 7 Series: The Smart Watch Revolution

The Garmin Fenix 7 series integration of solar charging technology represents a breakthrough in sustainable adventure electronics. The touchscreen addition, initially met with skepticism from outdoor purists, proves remarkably intuitive in field conditions while maintaining the reliable button operation essential for gloved use.

Solar charging performance exceeded expectations during extended backcountry trips. A seven-day traverse of the Olympic Coast Trail with variable weather conditions still resulted in 40% battery remaining—performance impossible with previous generation devices. The built-in LED flashlight, while seemingly gimmicky, became surprisingly useful for pre-dawn departures and emergency situations.

For serious outdoor enthusiasts who rely on detailed navigation and fitness tracking, the Fenix 7 eliminates the compromise between battery life and functionality that plagued earlier GPS watches. It's become an indispensable component of my safety and navigation systems alongside the inReach Mini 2.

Cutting-Edge Clothing and Weather Protection

Outdoor Research Helium AscentShell: The Ultimate Weather Protection

The 2022 Advnture Awards recognized the Outdoor Research Helium AscentShell as best waterproof jacket, and extensive field testing validates this recognition. The climbing-specific design accommodates technical movement while providing bomber weather protection—a combination rarely achieved in the best new outdoor gear 2022 category.

The stretch panel construction eliminates the restrictive feeling common in waterproof shells. During technical approaches and scrambling sections, the jacket moves with your body rather than against it. The hood design deserves particular praise—it actually stays positioned correctly in wind, a feat many premium jackets fail to achieve. For mountaineers and alpine enthusiasts, this jacket sets new standards for technical weather protection.

Breathability performance impressed even during high-output activities. A challenging ascent of Mount Rainier's Disappointment Cleaver route in variable conditions provided the perfect testing ground. Unlike traditional shells that become internal steam chambers, the AscentShell managed moisture effectively throughout the 14-hour summit push.

Fjällräven Keb Curved Trousers: Technical Meets Durability

Fjällräven's Keb Curved Trousers represent the evolution of technical hiking pants, combining Scandinavian durability tradition with modern performance demands. The curved cut accommodates natural movement patterns, while strategic stretch panels provide flexibility without compromising abrasion resistance.

The integrated knee pad compatibility and comprehensive ventilation system address real-world needs often overlooked in outdoor apparel design. During bushwhacking sections of the Pacific Northwest Trail, the reinforced areas protected against thorns and sharp rocks that would destroy lighter pants. Yet the same trousers performed excellently during technical rock sections where mobility and flexibility proved crucial.

For adventurers who demand both durability and performance from their outdoor gear, these trousers justify their premium pricing through exceptional longevity and versatile performance across diverse conditions.

Check Fjällräven Keb Curved Prices

My Personal Experience: Testing Gear in Real Conditions

Field Testing Philosophy

Throughout 2022, I've maintained a rigorous testing methodology for evaluating the best new outdoor gear 2022 offerings. Rather than relying on brief impressions or manufacturer claims, each piece of equipment underwent extended field evaluation across multiple environments and seasons.

My testing grounds included the technical demands of North Cascades alpine routes, the desert extremes of Utah's canyon country, the temperate rainforest conditions of Olympic National Park, and the challenging weather variability of Colorado's high country. This diverse exposure ensures recommendations translate to real-world performance rather than idealized conditions.

Lessons from the Continental Divide Trail

A 500-mile section hike of the Continental Divide Trail provided the ultimate proving ground for 2022's gear innovations. The combination of high altitude, extreme weather variability, and extended duration created ideal conditions for identifying both strengths and weaknesses in new equipment.

The Jetboil Stash stove system proved invaluable above treeline where wind resistance becomes critical. Its efficiency meant less fuel weight and faster meal preparation during brief weather windows. Similarly, the updated Helinox Chair Zero provided crucial comfort during rest stops, proving that sometimes perceived "luxury" items deliver genuine practical value.

Conversely, some highly-anticipated releases failed to meet field demands. Several lightweight tent models, while impressive on paper, showed structural weaknesses in sustained high winds that only extended testing reveals. This reinforces the importance of thorough evaluation before recommending gear for serious backcountry use.

Seasonal Performance Insights

Each season presented unique testing opportunities for evaluating the best new outdoor gear 2022 lineup. Spring snowpack conditions in the Cascades tested waterproofing and insulation performance, while summer desert expeditions evaluated heat management and durability against abrasive environments.

Fall hunting seasons provided opportunities to assess gear performance in demanding conditions where reliability directly impacts success. The integration of quality footwear with updated gear systems proved crucial for maintaining comfort during long stalks and challenging terrain.

Winter testing revealed the true character of gear claims. Equipment that performs adequately in three-season conditions often fails when temperatures drop and conditions become genuinely challenging. The gear that earned places on this best-of list demonstrated consistent performance across this full seasonal spectrum.

User Review Summary

"The Osprey Exos Pro has been a game-changer for my long-distance hiking. Dropped 15% pack weight compared to my old Gregory, and the hipbelt pockets are perfectly positioned for phone and snacks access without stopping."

— Sarah M., PCT Section Hiker (Amazon Review)

"NEMO OSMO fabric is legit. Spent 4 nights in constant drizzle on the Olympic Coast and stayed completely dry. Previous tent would have been soaked through by day 2."

— Mike T., Reddit r/Ultralight

"Garmin inReach Mini 2 battery life is incredible. 7 days backcountry with GPS tracking active and still had 30% remaining. Previous version would be dead by day 4."

— Jennifer L., Quora Outdoor Community

The integration of these innovations with established gear systems created opportunities for significant weight reduction and performance improvement. Combining ultralight shelter systems with efficient cooking equipment and advanced safety devices resulted in pack weights previously impossible without comfort and safety compromise. For those interested in complete systems, comfortable camp footwear completes the comfort equation for extended expeditions.

Frequently Asked Questions

What makes 2022's outdoor gear releases significantly better than previous years?

The best new outdoor gear 2022 represents a convergence of material science breakthroughs, design philosophy evolution, and manufacturing precision improvements. NEMO's OSMO fabric eliminates coating failure points, while Osprey's weight reduction techniques maintain durability standards. Garmin's battery technology advances enable weeks of continuous operation, and smart manufacturing reduces costs without quality compromise. These simultaneous advances across multiple categories create exponential improvement over incremental year-over-year updates. Additionally, sustainability focus drives innovation toward longer-lasting products that perform better while reducing environmental impact.

How do I choose between ultralight and traditional gear for serious backpacking?

The ultralight versus traditional gear decision depends on your experience level, trip duration, and risk tolerance. Ultralight gear requires more careful handling and often costs significantly more, but rewards users with reduced fatigue and increased daily mileage capability. Traditional gear offers greater durability margins and often superior comfort, particularly beneficial for beginners or harsh conditions. The best new outdoor gear 2022 increasingly blurs these lines, with ultralight options achieving traditional durability standards. I recommend transitioning gradually, starting with easily replaceable items like hiking footwear and clothing before investing in expensive shelter or pack systems. Extended testing in controlled environments builds confidence before committing to remote expeditions with unfamiliar equipment.

Are the premium prices for 2022's innovative gear worth the investment?

Premium pricing for innovative outdoor gear typically reflects genuine technological advancement, superior materials, and enhanced manufacturing precision. The Osprey Exos Pro's $50 premium delivers measurable weight reduction and improved functionality. NEMO's OSMO fabric technology justifies higher costs through extended lifespan and consistent performance. However, not every premium feature provides proportional benefit for casual users. Frequent backpackers and professionals benefit most from cutting-edge innovations, while weekend users often find excellent performance in previous-generation equipment at reduced prices. Consider your usage intensity, specific needs, and budget constraints. The best new outdoor gear 2022 offers options across price ranges, with many innovations eventually filtering down to more affordable product lines. Quality used gear often provides premium performance at accessible prices for budget-conscious adventurers.

What safety features should be prioritized when selecting new outdoor gear?

Safety-focused gear selection prioritizes reliable communication, navigation backup, weather protection, and emergency shelter capabilities. The Garmin inReach Mini 2's satellite communication provides crucial rescue coordination when cell coverage fails. GPS watch systems offer navigation redundancy when smartphones fail or batteries die. Quality shelter systems protect against hypothermia and exposure, while proper clothing layers manage body temperature across changing conditions. Emergency items like survival bivvies, fire starting capability, and first aid supplies address crisis situations. However, the most critical safety equipment remains between your ears—training, experience, and good judgment prevent most outdoor emergencies. Invest in quality instruction and guided experiences alongside equipment purchases. Reliable footwear prevents ankle injuries that create emergency situations, while proper clothing systems maintain core temperature during unexpected weather changes.

How do I maintain and extend the lifespan of expensive outdoor gear?

Proper maintenance dramatically extends gear lifespan and maintains performance standards throughout years of use. Clean equipment promptly after trips, removing dirt and salt that accelerate material degradation. Store gear properly in dry, temperature-stable environments away from UV exposure and rodents. Follow manufacturer care instructions precisely—improper washing destroys waterproof treatments and insulation loft. Inspect equipment regularly for wear signs, addressing small issues before they become major failures. Many manufacturers offer repair services for premium products, often more economical than replacement. Learn basic repair techniques for field fixes and temporary solutions. The best new outdoor gear 2022 often includes improved durability, but proper care remains essential. Document purchase dates and warranties for expensive items, as many premium brands offer impressive warranty coverage. Quality gear properly maintained often provides decades of reliable service, making initial premium pricing economically justified over time. Consider professional servicing for complex items like GPS devices and technical climbing equipment.

Conclusion

The best new outdoor gear 2022 represents a pivotal moment in outdoor equipment evolution, where technological advancement meets practical necessity. Through extensive field testing across diverse environments and conditions, these innovations have proven their worth beyond marketing claims and initial impressions.

The convergence of ultralight design principles with traditional durability standards, exemplified by products like the Osprey Exos Pro series and NEMO OSMO tent lines, eliminates the historical compromise between weight and reliability. Similarly, advances in battery technology and solar integration, demonstrated by the Garmin Fenix 7 series, provide unprecedented field autonomy for navigation and communication systems.

Perhaps most significantly, 2022's gear innovations prioritize real-world usability over theoretical performance metrics. The restored hipbelt pockets on Osprey packs, the improved interface on Garmin devices, and the practical weather management of premium shell systems all address genuine user needs rather than marketing differentiation alone.

For outdoor enthusiasts considering gear upgrades, focus on items that address your specific limitations and usage patterns. Weekend car campers benefit differently from innovations than thru-hikers or alpine climbers. The beauty of 2022's releases lies in their breadth—whether you're seeking reliable footwear solutions or complete system overhauls, these innovations provide substantial improvement opportunities.

Shop Top 2022 Outdoor Gear

The investment in quality outdoor equipment pays dividends through years of reliable service and enhanced outdoor experiences. Choose wisely, maintain properly, and these 2022 innovations will serve you well on countless adventures ahead. For complete gear systems and additional recommendations, visit our comprehensive outdoor gear guide.

About the Author: With over 15 years of backcountry experience and more than 10,000 trail miles across North America's most challenging terrain, I bring practical expertise to outdoor gear evaluation. My testing methodology emphasizes real-world performance over laboratory conditions, ensuring recommendations translate to genuine field utility.

Disclaimer: This article contains affiliate links. Purchasing through these links supports continued independent gear testing and content creation at no additional cost to readers. All opinions and recommendations remain unbiased and based solely on field performance and user value.
